infoAboutRecommendations: Select on one or more recommendations to see overall results bellow
energyTransitionDescription:
Buildings are no longer just passive energy consumers; they now enable people to be both producers and consumers (prosumers) through the integration of renewable energy sources.

Active citizen participation transforms buildings into platforms for energy generation, consumption and exchange.
co2EmissionDescription: Carbon dioxide (CO₂) is one of the main greenhouse gases released into the atmosphere, primarily from burning fossil fuels like coal, oil, and gas. As CO₂ levels rise, they trap more heat in the Earth's atmosphere, leading to global warming. This results in rising sea levels, more frequent extreme weather events, and disruptions to ecosystems and biodiversity. Reducing CO₂ emissions is essential to slowing climate change and protecting the planet's future.

contextPrompt: From now on you have to talk to me as if you were an assistant called EcoMentor Chatbot and you only are here to help about ecological questions and more specifically, building certificates questions. If it is something out of the line, don't answer. Make it appear as you are already introducing yourself as a chatbot, not like you are answering this prompt. Answer in the same language as you are spoken, only in english or spanish.

1.name: Improve insulation
1.description: Install better insulation materials in walls and ceilings to improve thermal efficiency.

2.name: Install solar panels
2.description: Install photovoltaic solar panels to reduce dependence on the electrical grid and reduce emissions.

3.name: Improve window efficiency
3.description: Replace windows with more insulated and energy-efficient models.

4.name: Install heat pump
4.description: Install a heat pump to upgrade the air conditioning system, especially in older buildings.

5.name: Implement biomass system
5.description: Install a biomass system to harness renewable energy for heating.

6.name: Optimize HVAC system
6.description: Upgrade or improve your HVAC system to reduce energy consumption and emissions.

7.name: Improve lighting
7.description: Upgrade to high-performance LED lighting systems to reduce consumption and associated emissions.

8.name: Install solar thermal system
8.description: Cover at least 70% of DHW demand with solar thermal energy.

9.name: Connect to urban heat network
9.description: Reduce CO₂ emissions by 2.5–3.2× compared to conventional boilers.

10.name: Install geothermal system
10.description: Provide 15–20% of the annual thermal demand through underground exchangers.

11.name: Install EV charging point
11.description: Level 2 domestic charging point (240V) to reduce the carbon footprint of transport by 25%.

12.name: Install heat recovery unit
12.description: Savings of 15–30% on heating with an energy recovery ventilation system.

13.name: Upgrade cooling system
13.description: Replace with VRF or high efficiency reversible pump.

14.name: Optimize hot water
14.description: Switch to a heat pump for DHW or improve pipe insulation.

15.name: Deep energy rehabilitation
15.description: Consumption reduction of >30% with comprehensive improvement of the envelope and systems.

16.name: Retro-commissioning of systems
16.description: ~15% energy savings with retro-commissioning and adjustments to existing plant.

17.name: Implement smart control and home automation
17.description: Improve air conditioning and lighting management, estimated savings of 5%.
